00030 import ConfigParser
00031 import os
00032 import sys
00033 from Koo import Rpc
00034 import Debug
00035 from PyQt4.QtCore import QDir, QUrl
00036 
00037 ## @brief The ConfigurationManager class handles Koo settings information. 
00038 # Those settings can be specified in the command line, .koorc configuration file
00039 # or koo server module.
00040 class Settings(object):
00041         rcFile = False
00042         options = {
00043                 'login.db': 'test',
00044                 'login.url': 'http://admin@localhost:8069',
00045                 'path.share': os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'share/Koo/'),
00046                 'path.pixmaps': os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'share/pixmaps/Koo/'),
00047                 'path.ui': os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'share/Koo/ui'), 
00048                 'tip.autostart': False,
00049                 'tip.position': 0,
00050                 'print_directly': False,
00051                 'client.default_path': os.path.expanduser('~'),
00052                 'client.language': False,
00053                 'stylesheet' : '',
00054                 'tabs_position' : 'top',
00055                 'tabs_closable' : True,
00056                 'show_toolbar' : True,
00057                 'sort_mode' : 'all_items',
00058                 'pos_mode' : False,
00059                 'enter_as_tab' : False,
00060                 'kde.enabled' : True,
00061                 'attachments_dialog' : False,
00062                 'debug': False,
00063         }
00064 
00065         ## @brief Stores current settings in the appropiate config file.
00066         @staticmethod
00067         def saveToFile():
00068                 if not Settings.rcFile:
00069                         Debug.warning( 'No rc file specified.' )
00070                         return False
00071                 try:
00072                         p = ConfigParser.ConfigParser()
00073                         sections = {}
00074                         for o in Settings.options.keys():
00075                                 if not len(o.split('.'))==2:
00076                                         continue
00077                                 osection,oname = o.split('.')
00078                                 if not p.has_section(osection):
00079                                         p.add_section(osection)
00080                                 p.set(osection,oname,Settings.options[o])
00081                         p.write(file(Settings.rcFile,'wb'))
00082                 except:
00083                         Debug.warning( 'Unable to write config file %s !' % Settings.rcFile )
00084                 return True
00085 
00086         ## @brief Loads settings from the appropiate config file.
00087         @staticmethod
00088         def loadFromFile():
00089                 if not Settings.rcFile:
00090                         Debug.warning( 'No rc file specified.' )
00091                         return False
00092                 try:
00093                         if not os.path.isfile(Settings.rcFile):
00094                                 Settings.save()
00095                                 return False
00096 
00097                         p = ConfigParser.ConfigParser()
00098                         p.read([Settings.rcFile])
00099                         for section in p.sections():
00100                                 for (name,value) in p.items(section):
00101                                         if value=='True' or value=='true':
00102                                                 value = True
00103                                         if value=='False' or value=='false':
00104                                                 value = False
00105                                         Settings.options[section+'.'+name] = value
00106                 except Exception, e:
00107                         Debug.warning( 'Unable to read config file %s !' % Settings.rcFile )
00108                 return True
00109 
00110         ## @brief Sets the value for the given key.
00111         @staticmethod
00112         def setValue(key, value):
00113                 Settings.options[key]=value
00114 
00115         ## @brief Returns the value for the given key.
00116         @staticmethod
00117         def value(key, defaultValue=None):
00118                 return Settings.options.get(key, defaultValue)
00119 
00120         ## @brief Returns the value associated with the given key. If the key has no valu
00121         # returns defaultValue
00122         @staticmethod
00123         def get(key, defaultValue=None):
00124                 return Settings.options.get(key, defaultValue)
00125 
00126         ## @brief Tries to load settings from koo server module.
00127         # If the module is not installed, no exception or error is thrown.
00128         @staticmethod
00129         def loadFromServer():
00130                 try:
00131                         settings = Rpc.session.call( '/object', 'execute', 'nan.koo.settings', 'get_settings' )
00132                 except:
00133                         settings = {}
00134                 Settings.options.update( settings )
00135                 Rpc.ViewCache.exceptions = Settings.options.get('cache_exceptions', [])
